channel.title: Side Channel on NetSec
channel.description: Recent content in Side Channel on NetSec

item.title: Acta #009
item.description: Timeless Timing Attacks: Exploiting Concurrency to Leak Secrets over Remote Connections 29th USENIX Security Symposium, 2020 [PDF, Info] Abstract To perform successful remote timing attacks, an adversarytypically collects a series of network timing measurementsand subsequently performs statistical analysis to reveal a dif-ference in execution time. The number of measurements thatmust be obtained largely depends on the amount of jitter thatthe requests and responses are subjected to. In remote tim-ing attacks, a significant source of jitter is the network pathbetween the adversary and the targeted server, making it prac-tically infeasible to successfully exploit timing side-channelsthat exhibit only a small difference in execution time.
